Package daehee

Class Tokenizer

java.lang.Object
daehee.Tokenizer
public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
The class prepares a message to tokenize into different types.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Tokenizer()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private boolean checkValidity​(java.lang.String[] splitText)
    It checks if the message has a valid format to continue with tokenization.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> tokenizeContent​(java.lang.Object stringObj)
    It tokenizes a single line of message into texts and smiles.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> tokenizeMessage​(java.lang.String text)
    It checks for the front substring of a line and returns the rest of the string after colon (:) if the front substring matches any of the Indicators otherwise throws an exception for a wrong input file.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Tokenizer

      public Tokenizer()

  • Method Details

    • tokenizeMessage

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> tokenizeMessage​(java.lang.String text) throws IncorrectFormatException
      It checks for the front substring of a line and returns the rest of the string after colon (:) if the front substring matches any of the Indicators otherwise throws an exception for a wrong input file.
      Parameters:
      text - the entirety of text extracted from the .msg file
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of strings separated by line
      Throws:
      IncorrectFormatException - an exception caught when the file does not have correct syntax

    • tokenizeContent

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> tokenizeContent​(java.lang.Object stringObj)
      It tokenizes a single line of message into texts and smiles. If more Smileys are added to Smile, it is recommended to tweak this function for the Smileys.
      Parameters:
      stringObj - the input string representing CONTENT that has been tokenized from a message text
      Returns:
      ArrayList of texts and smiles to be displayed in a TextFlow

    • checkValidity

      private boolean checkValidity​(java.lang.String[] splitText)
      It checks if the message has a valid format to continue with tokenization.
      Parameters:
      splitText - an array of strings split from a message text by line separator
      Returns:
      true or false depending on the legitimacy of the format
